messageBody:
I'm guessing the object is a singleton or something simliar - in which
case you would not want to make the constructor public - especially
for the purposes of testing only.

- Rob

On 6/23/05, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
> mcgeejdw2004 wrote:
>
> > I have a class with a private constructor and a static factory method
> > that returns an instance. I would like to run a Junit test that tests
> > a few methods of this class but I do not want to make the constructor
> > public and I would rather avoid creating a mock object to pass to the
> > static factory because this could take some time to develop. What is
> > the best way to handle this?
>
> 1. Make the constructor package-level and move the tests into the same
> package.
>
> 2. Make the constructor public, extract an interface from the class,
> then change the factory method to return an object of the interface type.
>
> I wouldn't try anything more complicated than those. I much prefer #2.
> --
